thread.title: JetBlue Appoints Jim Sullivan to Vice President, Flight Operations

author: cnbc.com
title: JetBlue Appoints Jim Sullivan to Vice President, Flight Operations
text:
NEW YORK--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- JetBlue Airways (Nasdaq:JBLU), New York’s Hometown Airline®, today announces the appointment of Jim Sullivan as the carrier’s Vice President, Flight Operations.
This press release features multimedia. View the full release here: https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20180416005946/en/
JetBlue Appoints Jim Sullivan to Vice President, Flight Operations (Photo: Business Wire)
Sullivan, who joins JetBlue today, is responsible for the award-winning airline’s flight operations and flight standards. He will report directly to Warren Christie, the airline’s Senior Vice President, Safety, Security & Air Operations and will be based at JetBlue’s main support center in Long Island City, N.Y.
Sullivan began his aviation career nearly 30 years ago, with the majority of that time spent at Frontier Airlines. In 2015, he joined Surf Air, becoming a member of the senior team at the California-based commuter airline. In his most recent position, he was Chief Operating Officer at Great Lakes Aviation. An experienced airline captain, he is type rated on the B737, A320, LR-JET and the CE-500.
“Jim’s broad industry experience, array of senior leadership roles, and commitment to servant leadership is an impressive combination,” said Christie. “I’m confident that he will lead with JetBlue’s values in mind, with a focus on strengthening and growing the flight operations team and guiding us to the next chapter in JetBlue’s growth.”
“I am excited for the opportunity to join this much admired airline,” said Sullivan. “I am looking forward to working alongside JetBlue’s pilots and contributing to the airline’s continued success.”
About JetBlue Airways
JetBlue is New York's Hometown Airline®, and a leading carrier in Boston, Fort Lauderdale - Hollywood, Los Angeles (Long Beach), Orlando, and San Juan. JetBlue carries more than 40 million customers a year to 101 cities in the U.S., Caribbean, and Latin America with an average of 1,000 daily flights. For more information please visit www.jetblue.com .
